questions.question: 1. A mild steel bar specimen of diameter 20 mm is subjected to a tensile test. The bar was found to yield under a load of 82.5 kN and the specimen attained a maximum load of 155 kN and ultimately broke at a load of 72.5 kN. What is the tensile stress on the yield point?

explanations.a:
Original sectional area of the specimen = π/4 x (20)2 = 314.2 mm2
Tensile stress at yielding = 82.5 x 1000 / 314.2 = 262.6 N/mm2

questions.question: 2. A mild steel bar specimen of diameter 20 mm is subjected to a tensile test. The bar was found to yield under a load of 82.5 kN and the specimen attained a maximum load of 155 kN and ultimately broke at a load of 72.5 kN. What is the ultimate stress?

explanations.c:
Ultimate Stress means the nominal stress corresponding to the maximum load
Ultimate Stress = 155 x 1000/ 314.15 = 493.3 N/mm2

questions.question: 3. A mild steel bar specimen of diameter 20 mm is subjected to a tensile test. The bar was found to yield under a load of 82.5 kN and the specimen attained a maximum load of 155 kN and ultimately broke at a load of 72.5 kN. What is the average stress at the breaking point if the diameter of the neck is 10.75 mm?

explanations.c:
Area of the specimen in the necked portion = π/4 x (10.75)2 = 90.76 mm2
Average size at the breaking point = 72.5 x 1000 / 90.76 = 798.8 N/mm2
